Articles.Content:
Here's my version of the McDonnell F-101 Voodoo. It had different roles when it was in service from jet fighter to photo recon craft.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

This plane may be a bit awkward when taking off due to the landing gear in the wings, but it can take off in short distances. The Voodoo also went fast enough to be in orbit for a short time...

Although, it's mostly stock, the only mod parts here are the fuselage tail from the Firespitter mod.

Craft file: http://www./view/wa6lf6p2hcz7jxc/F-101_Voodoo.craft

Nice bit of work on this. Looks like you attached the wings to the air intakes. You'd likely get a bit more stability, without the struts, if you attached wings to the fuselage and then attached the cones for the engines.
